intro: Gomphrena conwayi, commonly known as the Conway's feathery gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, feathery inflorescences that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Gomphrena conwayi is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional medicine by some indigenous communities.
